chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant April Mei Branville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$1,300.00 restitution, plus a 10% surcharge of $130.00 to DA's office, plus a 5% restitution surcharge of $94.78 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts. Joint and several restitution with Derek Gustason 22CF236.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Must complete assessment as soon as possible, enroll within 60 days.

No contact with LWB.

No contact with Derek Gustason.

Absolute sobriety.

No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. 

No drug paraphernalia.

No alcohol.

Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by Probation if necessary. Not subject to good time.

SENTENCE: W/held 1 year probation. Must report to probation as soon as possible. AODA and comply. Must enroll as soon as possible. No contact with LWB. No contact with Derek Gustason. Plus 5% surcharge to COCC. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. 0 days credit. PCR. 2:07 pm adj.
